hook.text: A new hire needs hand-holding. A veteran needs space. The same leadership style won't work for both.

buildup.text: Situational leadership says effective leaders adapt their style to the maturity and skill of their followers.

discovery.text: Hersey and Blanchard defined four modes: telling, selling, participating, and delegatingâ€”matched to readiness.

twist.text: The same person may need different styles for different tasks. A coding expert might be a presentation novice.

climax.text: Great leaders diagnose before they prescribe. They read the person and the moment, then adjust their approach.

punchline.text: One size never fits all. Flexibility is the leader's superpower.

quiz.question: What does situational leadership require leaders to adapt to?
options: The follower's maturity and skill level
